<small>Also see: [[H4128]]</small>

 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָדַד‎</span><sub>53</sub> **verb** ==measure== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Phoenician <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מדד‎</span>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***extend, stretch***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***a corn-measure***, etc.; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***madâdu***</u></abbr>, ***measure***; Jewish-Aramaic noun <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִידָּה‎</span> ***measure, proportion, rule***); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָדָ֑ד‎</span>) [[Isa.40.12|Isa 40:12]] + 9 t. Ezekiel; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְדָדוֺ‎</span> [[Ezek.42.15|Ezek 42:15]]; [[Ezek.42.20|Ezek 42:20]] 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמַדֹּתִ֫י‎</span> [[Isa.65.7|Isa 65:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמָֽדְדוּ‎</span> consecutive [[Deut.21.2|Deut 21:2]]; [[Ezek.43.10|Ezek 43:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמַדֹּתֶם‎</span> consecutive [[Num.35.5|Num 35:5]] ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיָּ֫מָד‎</span> [[Ruth.3.15|Ruth 3:15]] + 22 t. Ezekiel; 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תָּמוֺד‎</span> [[Ezek.45.3|Ezek 45:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיָּמֹ֫דּוּ‎</span> [[Exod.16.18|Exod 16:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תָּמֹ֫דּוּ‎</span> [[Ezek.47.18|Ezek 47:18]] ***Infinitive*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָמֹד‎</span> [[Zech.2.6|Zech 2:6]] — ***measure***, chiefly literal (usually followed by accusative ***of thing***; object omitted [[Exod.16.18|Exod 16:18]]; [[Deut.21.2|Deut 21:2]]; [[Ezek.40.35|Ezek 40:35]], compare [[Ezek.47.18|Ezek 47:18]] (but see [[BDB#Co|Co]]); followed by accusative of measure [[Ruth.3.15|Ruth 3:15]]; [[Ezek.42.19|Ezek 42:19]]; [[Ezek.47.3|Ezek 47:3]]; [[Ezek.47.4|Ezek 47:4]] (twice in verse); [[Ezek.47.5|Ezek 47:5]]); — 

**1.** measure of length, distance [[Num.35.5|Num 35:5]] ([[BDB#P|P]]), [[Deut.21.2|Deut 21:2]] ([[BDB#D|D]]), [[Ezek.40.5|Ezek 40:5]]; [[Ezek.40.6|Ezek 40:6]]; [[Ezek.40.8|Ezek 40:8]]; [[Ezek.40.20|Ezek 40:20]] + 32 t. Ezek 40-47 [[Zech.2.6|Zech 2:6]]. 

**2.** of dry measure [[Exod.16.18|Exod 16:18]] ([[BDB#P|P]]), [[Ruth.3.15|Ruth 3:15]]. 

**3.** figurative of measuring waters [[Isa.40.12|Isa 40:12]] (of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>); of requital [[Isa.65.7|Isa 65:7]]. **Niph\`al** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִמַּד‎</span> [[Hos.2.1|Hos 2:1]]; [[Jer.33.22|Jer 33:22]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִמַּדּוּ‎</span> [[Jer.31.37|Jer 31:37]] — ***be measured***, of sand of sea [[Hos.2.1|Hos 2:1]]; [[Jer.33.22|Jer 33:22]] of heavens [[Jer.31.37|Jer 31:37]]. **Pi\`el** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמִדַּדֿ‎</span> consecutive [[Job.7.4|Job 7:4]] (compare [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:52»§ 52</sup>. 2. R. l); ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְמַדֵּד‎</span> [[2Sam.8.2|2Sam 8:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְמַדְּדֵם‎</span> v[[2Sam.8.2|2Sam 8:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲמַדֵּד‎</span> [[Ps.60.8|Ps 60:8]]; [[Ps.108.8|Ps 108:8]] — 

**1.** ***extend, continue*** (= make extent ***or*** continuation), subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֶרֶב‎</span> [[Job.7.4|Job 7:4]]. 

**2.** ***measure, measure off***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַחֶבֶל‎</span>, of apportioning Moabites to death and life, followed by suffix [[2Sam.8.2|2Sam 8:2]] also object <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבָלִים‎</span> v[[2Sam.8.2|2Sam 8:2]] metaphor of conquest, followed by accusative, [[Ps.60.8|Ps 60:8]] = [[Ps.108.8|Ps 108:8]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חִלֵּק‎</span>). **Po.** ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְמֹ֫דֶד‎</span> [[Hab.3.6|Hab 3:6]] (subject God, object <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶרֶץ‎</span>), ***measured*** (namely, with eye) [[BDB#Vg|ᵑ9]] [[BDB#Hi|Hi]] [[BDB#AV|AV]] [[BDB#RV|RV]], but dubious; [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">ἐσαλεύθη</span>, [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲזִיעַ‎</span>, hence ***shook*** [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#Ke|Ke]] [[BDB#Or|Or]] and others (from √ [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוֺד‎</span> =] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוֺט‎</span>, but read then rather <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְמֹטֵט‎</span>, although <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוט‎</span> not elsewhere in this conjugation; [[BDB#We|We]], plausibly, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיְמֹגֵג‎</span> √ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מוג‎</span>, compare [[Nah.1.5|Nah 1:5]]). **Hithpo\`el** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּתְמֹדֵד‎</span> followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלהַֿיֶ֫לֶד‎</span>; [[1Kgs.17.21|1Kgs 17:21]] ***measured*** (= extended, stretched) ***himself*** upon the boy.
